frameDefinitions: A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
A Self_mover leaves an initial Source location.
An Agent changes Tools, from the Old_tool to a New_tool.
A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.

A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').
frameExamples: Mike <t>avoided</t> his supervisor at all costs.
If this happens one more time, we 're going to <t>switch</t> operating systems.
You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> avoids an <fen>Undesirable_situation</fen>.
This role identifies the situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> avoids.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the avoiding occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the avoiding occurs.
This is the entity which moves under its own power.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
The individual that changes their situation.
The entities controlled by an Agent to achieve some Purpose.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> had been using.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> ends up using.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a change.

The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.

The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
listRoleExamples: In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
<fex>Mike</fex> avoided his supervisor at all costs.
Mike avoided <fex>his supervisor</fex> at all costs.

The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Gulf Coast Athletic All-Conference Team
the Gulf Coast Athletic Conference Championship
the Gulf Coast Athletic All-Conference Team
the Quarterfinals of the NAIA National Tournament
the Gulf Coast Athletic All-Conference Team
Most Valuable Player of NAIA National Tournament
